name: Sokoban With Level Editor
description:
Just another Sokoban game shipped with an easy-to-use level editor.  Complete the built-in levels or create your own! The project was created as a university assignment during the first semester of my Computer Engineering studies in 2016 autumn.

Game Rules
You have to move boxes using your character.
A level is completed if each target-field contains a box.
You are allowed to move only one box at a time.
Boxes might get stuck. You can restart a level at any time.

Navigation in menu
UP ARROW - move up
DOWN ARROW - move down
ENTER - select option
ESC - go back

In-game controls
Arrow keys - move character
R - restart level
W A S D - move camera
K - enable/disable follow mode on camera
ESC - return to menu

Level Editor
You can create your own levels and play them in Casual Mode.
Drag the tiles from the palette onto the screen.
Move the camera by using W, A, S, D keys.
Delete any tile by left-clicking on it.
Press T to remove unnecessary walls.
Before saving a level, you must validate it.
Press Enter to validate and complete the level.
After that, in the Editor, press M to save the validated level.
You cannot overwrite built-in levels.

Have FUN!

I do not own the sprites of the player character presented in the game. The game was implemented in the C programming language using the SDL, SDL_gfx and SDL_image libraries.
